metadata.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
metadata.comment: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\schtasks.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('schtasks.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onlogon ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onstart ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' once ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onidle '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('nt aut')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' system')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('highest'))))

output.summary: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

metadata.objective: False positive: Some installers were seen using this method of creation unfortunately. Filter them in your environment References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/schtasks-change, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/schtasks-create
